alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Washington (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:07AM CST until February 21 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Meramec River near Sullivan. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meramec River near Sullivan. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, At this height the entire Arapaho campground will be under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 17.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Meramec River Sullivan 11.0 7.0 Thu 9 am 16.7 14.7 9.9 7.5 6.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The NationalWeather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
